alert.note: Alert for Central Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 17 at 8:24PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Des Plaines River at Riverside affecting Central Cook zone. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Des Plaines River from near Riverside to near Lyons. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Low-lying areas along the river may flood, including forest preserve and park land * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Wednesday, river gauges indicated a developing ice jam located on the Des Plains River near Riverside and Lyons. The river gauge at Riverside indicated the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...Water levels may continue to rise as ice accumulates on the ice jam. Flooding of overbank areas along the river is possible in the coming days. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 230 PM CST.
